message.content: {"id": "45145", "title": "Bug 45145: Second window comes to front when using first", "description": "", "OB": "When switching from another application to an Eclipse window, and then clicking on a docked view or perspective, the other window comes to the front over windows of other applications. This behavior is not expected.", "EB": "The only time a window should come to the front is if I click on it explicitly, or if an action takes me to a widget in the other window. Clicking on the Eclipse dock icon should not be required to bring a window to the front.", "SR": "Ensure that windows in Eclipse do not automatically come to the front when clicking on docked views or perspectives. The expected behavior is that a window should come to the front only if it is clicked on explicitly or if an action takes the user to a widget in the other window."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '45145', 'title': 'Bug 45145Second window comes to front when using first', 'description': '', 'OB': "Bug 45145Second window comes to front when using first If I switch in from another application to one Eclipse window, and thenclick on a docked view, or perspective, the other window comes to the front over my otherapplications' windows. ", 'EB': 'Unless I click on the Eclipse dock icon, the only time a window should cometo the front is if I click on it explicitly (or some behavior takes me to a widget in the other window). ', 'SR': ''}
